noun.description: A verse or line consisting of five metrical feet; a sequence of five metrical feet in a verse.

origin: Mid 19th century. From German Pentapodie from ancient Greek πεντα- + ποδ-, πούς foot + -ία; compare ancient Greek πεντέπους, Hellenistic Greek πεντάπους (adjective) of five feet, five feet long.
